CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 1954, pg. 1, reads: "Urban League Week Proclaimed - The week of Sept. 5-10 has been set aside as Urban League Week, to honor the contributions of the National Urban League in 'helping to develop higher community standards and greater opportunities for all Americans.' Mayor David L. Lawrence signed the proclamation Monday. Seated with him are Pittsburgh Urban League board members: Mrs. Robert L. Vann, left, and Henry Pearson. Watching the proceedings are Mrs. Nathaniel Dandridge and Councilman Patrick T. Fagan, secretary and president of the Local Urban League, respectively. (Other pictures on page one. Second Section.) - Harris Photo."David L. Lawrence was Mayor of the City of Pittsburgh 1946-1959, Governor of Pennsylvania 1959-1963, and he died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence signing proclamation, surrounded by Jessie Vann, Helen Dandridge, Henry Pearson, and Patrick T. Fagan, in Office of the Mayor, City County Building
